channel.title: [Delta] I forgot how to raise XP rates in delta
channel.description:
i worked for long time in PI
that i totaly forgot how to do this into delta
change the xp rates of combat
in PI it would be config.java but idk in delta
___________________________________________ Before starting to ask why i went back to delta.
i just started a huge project and the beta version will be in delta
if that is gona be cool and allricht i make it to PI

item.title: [Delta] I forgot how to raise XP rates in delta
item.dc:creator: @Oh-Noes Oh-Noes
item.description:
@Oh-Noes wrote:

Look for any instances of addSkillXP.
It works like: addSkillXP(amount, skillID)
So you can just change the second number to increase or decrease XP gains in certain places.

Alternatively, you can change universal XP rates by altering the method itself. For example, this:

public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) { ... playerXP[skill] += amount;
could be changed to something like:

public boolean addSkillXP(int amount, int skill) { ... playerXP[skill] += amount*2;
Which would effectively double any XP gains.

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] I forgot how to raise XP rates in delta

but u just needed a easy words to do ctrl+f with but idk the words anymore

item.title: [Delta] I forgot how to raise XP rates in delta
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

In delta there is no XP modifiers, everything is hardcoded. I would recommend you not use it.
